parts.text:
You’ve been asked to implement the part of a role playing video-game handling hostile non-
playing characters (Mobs).
Some of these mobs are able to hold an item in their hands. There are 3 different items and they
are defined as:
✓ Sword
✓ Bow
✓ MagicWand
1
Task 01
Write the data structure to describe these items. The name of the data-structure must be Item,
and each item can be created using its name:

message.text:
You’ve been asked to implement the part of a role playing video-game handling hostile non-
playing characters (Mobs).
Some of these mobs are able to hold an item in their hands. There are 3 different items and they
are defined as:
✓ Sword
✓ Bow
✓ MagicWand
1
Task 01
Write the data structure to describe these items. The name of the data-structure must be Item,
and each item can be created using its name:

response.value:
data Item = Sword | Bow | MagicWand
  deriving (Show, Eq)
```

data Item = Sword | Bow | MagicWand
  deriving (Show, Eq)

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.
* **Review my suggested code** and tell me about issues or improvements, so I can iterate on it.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

Learn more about [GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode&utm_source=editor&utm_medium=chat-panel&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-getstarted) in [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/overview). parts.text:
I want my data structures to work as followed

```
ghci> Sword
sword
ghci> Bow
bow
ghci> MagicWand
magic wand
```

message.text:
I want my data structures to work as followed

```
ghci> Sword
sword
ghci> Bow
bow
ghci> MagicWand
magic wand
```

response.value:
To achieve this, you need to implement a custom `Show` instance for your `Item` type instead of deriving it. Here’s how you can do it:

````haskell

{-
-- EPITECH PROJECT, 2025
-- day03
-- File description:
-- Game
-}

data Item = Sword | Bow | MagicWand
  deriving (Eq)

instance Show Item where
  show Sword     = "sword"
  show Bow       = "bow"
  show MagicWand = "magic wand"
````

  show Bow       = "bow"
  show MagicWand = "magic wand"
